snippet: Bankers voiced complaints about a euro zone proposal to limit bonuses, but it appears that banks will have ways to get around it.
abstract: News analysis; European proposal to limit bonuses in the financial industry could be ineffective or even counterproductive, as bankers threaten to decamp to other countries; many observers expect industry to find ways of skirting new regulations.

byline.contributor: Michael J. de la Merced and Peter Eavis contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Bankers voiced complaints about a euro zone proposal to limit bonuses, but it appears that banks will have ways to get around it.

headline.seo: Euro Zone Plan to Limit Bonuses Rattles Bankers
headline.main: Outcry, and a Little Cunning, From Euro Bankers
headline.print_headline: Outcry, and a Little Cunning, From Euro Bankers
